content.question: Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction with numerator e raised to the 2 x power, and denominator 1 minus e raised to the 2 x power, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following describes all asymptotes of the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: No vertical asymptotes and two horizontal asymptotes
One vertical asymptote and no horizontal asymptotes
One vertical asymptote and two horizontal asymptotes
Two vertical asymptotes and two horizontal asymptotes

content.answer: One vertical asymptote and two horizontal asymptotes

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes
